availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Stewart (Green County, Kentucky, blacksmith and farmer)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, blacksmith and farmer. Tennessee native. Son of Richard Stewart and Polly Stewart. Married to Laura Beams Stewart in Green County, Kentucky, on September 13, 1852. Father of Parthena Stewart, Fielding Stewart, Elizabeth Stewart, and Samuel Stewart. Farmer in Johnson County, Illinois, in 1850. Blacksmith and farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Johnson County, District 2, p. 352B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 653.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Menard County, Petersburg, p. 93B.
"John Stewart (1831-1916," Find A Grave, Memorial 28647401, accessed June 6, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28647401.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Marriages, p. 1.
